intro: Ricinocarpus adenotrichus, commonly known as the hairy sea bean, is a tropical flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits that are covered in fine, hairy structures. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Its leaves are trifoliate, with each leaflet having a serrated edge. Ricinocarpus adenotrichus plays a role in stabilizing dunes and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
